item.title: Automobile retail sales decline 12% in December; jump 9% in CY2024: FADA - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Automobile retail sales decline 12% in December; jump 9% in CY2024: FADA

Date: January 07, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

Automobile retail sales faced a decline in December but reported overall growth for the year 2024. The Federation of Automobile Dealers Associations (FADA) highlights the resilience of the auto retail industry amid various challenges.

  • December retail sales declined by 12%.
  • Overall vehicle registrations totaled 2,61,07,679 units in 2024, marking a 9% growth compared to 2023.
  • Significant demand for two-wheelers and passenger vehicles supported growth despite challenging conditions.
  • President C S Vigneshwar cited multiple headwinds impacting the sector, including weather conditions and elections.
"Despite multiple headwinds in CY24, including heatwaves, elections at both central and state levels and uneven monsoon, the auto retail industry remained resilient." - C S Vigneshwar, FADA President

The automobile retail sector showed both decline and growth trends, pointing to a fluctuating market influenced by external factors in 2024.

item.title: Gold steadily climb back closer to $2,650, lacks follow-through - FXStreet
item.description:
Gold Bulls Show Uncertainty Amid Fed's Hawkish Signals

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: FXStreet

The gold price is showing a mild positive bias but struggles to gain momentum due to geopolitical risks and the Federal Reserve's hawkish stance.

  • Gold attracts haven flows amid concerns about US trade policies.
  • The Fed’s hawkish stance caps potential gains for gold amidst rising bond yields.
  • Traders are waiting for FOMC minutes and Nonfarm Payrolls reports.
“Despite significant progress in lowering price pressures, inflation remains uncomfortably above the 2% target.” - San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly

The current market environment reflects caution among traders as they assess both geopolitical tensions and forthcoming economic reports, indicating potential volatility in gold prices.

item.title: Equinox India shares in 20% upper circuit after NCLAT approves merger with Embassy - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Equinox India Shares Surge 20% After NCLAT Approves Merger with Embassy Group

Date: Jan 7, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

Equinox India Developments Ltd. shares are locked in a 20% upper circuit after the NCLAT approved the merger with Embassy Group.

  • The deal was first announced in August 2020.
  • Approval by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) was granted in February 2021.
  • The NCLT Bengaluru bench had previously approved the merger.
  • Concerns from the income tax department stalled the merger in March 2023.
  • The NCLAT has allowed the merger, setting aside previous concerns.
  • The merger will result in the Embassy Group holding a majority stake in the new entity.
  • Equinox India was formerly known as Indiabulls Real Estate.
  • Shares are currently priced at 143.58.
The NCLAT is trying to put to an end, an issue that has stretched over four years.

This merger marks a significant step for Equinox India Developments as it navigates through regulatory challenges.

item.title: One Mobikwik Systems shares climb around 8% ahead of Q2 results announcement | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
One Mobikwik Systems shares climb around 8% ahead of Q2 results announcement

Date: January 7, 2024

Source: Live Mint

One Mobikwik Systems shares increased by 8% to ₹601.35 ahead of the Q2 earnings announcement for the September quarter of 2024, marking the first such announcement since its IPO.

  1. The stock debuted on December 18, 2024, at a 58.51% premium, currently trading 115% above its IPO price.
  2. MobiKwik reported a 62.2% revenue increase to ₹875 crore in FY24.
  3. The company achieved profitability with a PBT of ₹14 crore, contrasting with a loss of ₹81 crore in FY23.
  4. Notable EBITDA improvement with a margin of 2.5% in FY24, compared to -14.4% in FY23.
  5. Its market share in India's PPI wallet segment is 23.11% by gross transaction value as of May 2024.
"The capital raised through the IPO is being allocated to scale financial and payment services, bolster AI and machine learning capabilities."

MobiKwik's growth is propelled by a strong digital payment ecosystem, enhancing its role as a leader in digital financial services.

item.title: SENSEX rises 400 pts in early trade; NIFTY50 trades above 23,750; Titan surges over 2%, Zomato drops 5% - Upstox
item.description:
Stock Market Gains: SENSEX Up 400 Points Amid Mixed Performances

Publication Date: January 7, 2024 | Source: [News Website]

The domestic equity market showed positive momentum at the start of trading on Tuesday, with the S&P BSE SENSEX rising significantly, while mixed performances were observed in individual stocks.

  • The S&P BSE SENSEX was up 394.39 points, trading at 78,359.38.
  • The NSE's NIFTY50 index gained 135.60 points, reaching 23,751.65.
  • 43 out of 50 NIFTY50 components were in the green, while Zomato faced a notable decline.
  • Top gainers on the index included ONGC, Titan, and BPCL.
  • Zomato shares dropped over 4% amid concerns over competition.
“2025 could be a breather year for Zomato, with the stock likely shifting gears into a phase of price consolidation.” - Jefferies Analysts

The market showed broad sectoral gains, with oil and gas leading, while foreign institutional investors reportedly sold equities worth ₹2,575.06 crore yesterday.

item.title: Nvidia is helping humanoid robots learn through Apple Vision Pro instruction - TechCrunch
item.description:
Nvidia is helping humanoid robots learn through Apple Vision Pro instruction

Published on: Not specified Source: TechCrunch

Robotics have significantly contributed to Nvidia’s growth, with the launch of GR00T heralding a pivotal moment in humanoid robotics. The recent addition of Blueprint emphasizes imitation learning, allowing robots to learn skills by mimicking human actions through the Apple Vision Pro.

  • Nvidia's GR00T platform integrates big names in humanoid robotics.
  • Imitation learning enables robots to learn through observation and mimicry.
  • Teleoperation facilitates remote teaching of robotic systems.
  • Apple's Vision Pro is utilized to create digital twins for simulation.
“Imitation learning is what it sounds like. A person performs an action and the robot follows suit.”

The integration of these technologies signals an advancement in how humanoid robots can be trained, potentially revolutionizing their deployment in practical scenarios.

item.title: Air India flight makes emergency landing after engine shuts off midair - The Hindu
item.description:
Air India Flight 2820 Makes Emergency Landing Due to Engine Failure

Date: January 07, 2025 Source: The Hindu

A Delhi-bound Air India flight made an emergency landing after one of its engines shut off midair. The flight, that took off from Kempegowda International Airport in Bengaluru, returned safely with no incidents reported.

  • The incident occurred on January 5, 2024, shortly after takeoff.
  • Flight 2820 took off around 7 p.m. and circled Bengaluru before landing an hour later.
  • All passengers were reported safe with no injuries.
No untoward incident happened and all the passengers were safe.

This emergency landing highlights the importance of aircraft safety and protocol in the aviation industry.

item.title: FIIs bet $1 billion on IT stocks before Q3 results. Does it signal a happy new year? - The Economic Times
item.description:
FIIs bet $1 billion on IT stocks before Q3 results. Does it signal a happy new year?

Publication Date: January 9 | Source: Economic Times

Ahead of the Q3 results season, foreign institutional investors (FIIs) have invested over $1 billion in IT stocks, betting on a potential recovery in the sector as macroeconomic conditions improve.

  • FIIs invested Rs 15,446 crore in December, with Rs 9,050 crore specifically in IT stocks.
  • Analysts expect the Q3 results for IT companies to be mixed, but project growth recovery in FY26.
  • HCL Tech is anticipated to report a 3.5% quarter-on-quarter growth, while Wipro is expected to see a -1% impact.
  • Brokerages like Motilal Oswal suggest LTIMindtree as a top pick among Tier-1 players, anticipating better revenue growth fueled by a favorable macro environment.
"As we head into 2025, the macroeconomic environment is far better placed than it has been in the last two years." - Kumar Rakesh, BNP Paribas Analyst

This heavy investment from FIIs may indicate confidence in the Indian IT sector's recovery as they expect improved discretionary spending in the near future.

item.title: Nvidia releases its own brand of world models - TechCrunch
item.description:
Nvidia Launches Cosmos World Foundation Models for AI Development

Date: January 6, 2025

Source: TechCrunch

Nvidia has announced the release of its Cosmos World Foundation Models (Cosmos WFM) during CES 2025 in Las Vegas, providing a family of AI models designed for physics-aware video generation. These models are available to researchers and developers under a permissive open model license.

  • The Cosmos WFMs can predict and generate physics-aware videos.
  • The models are divided into three categories: Nano, Super, and Ultra, based on their performance capabilities.
  • Nvidia has released a video decoder optimized for augmented reality within the Cosmos framework.
  • Cosmos models were trained on extensive datasets comprising interactions across various domains such as industrial and robotics.
  • Companies like Waabi, Wayve, and Uber are piloting these models for applications in autonomous driving.
“Nvidia is making available the first wave of Cosmos WFMs for physics-based simulation and synthetic data generation,” the company stated.

Nvidia's CEO expressed hope that Cosmos will achieve significant impact in the robotics and AI sectors similar to what other successful AI models have done for enterprise applications.

item.title: Mobikwik Q2 Results LIVE: Shares rise 2.3% ahead of earnings announcement today - Upstox
item.description:
Mobikwik Q2 Results LIVE: Shares rise 2.3% ahead of earnings announcement today

Date: January 7, 2025

Source: Upstox

Introduction: One MobiKwik Systems is set to announce its Q2 financial results, demonstrating significant stock movement ahead of the earnings announcement.

Key Points:

  • Shares increased by 2.3%, with the current price at ₹574.15.
  • The stock opened at ₹565.10, reached a high of ₹600.90, and a low of ₹563.05.
  • MobiKwik's market capitalization is ₹4,654.96 crore.
  • The stock has increased by over 100% from its initial issue price since its listing.
“One MobiKwik Systems Limited has informed the Exchange about Board Meeting to be held on 07-Jan-2025 to inter-alia consider and approve the Unaudited Financial results of the Company for the Quarterly ended September 2024.”

Conclusion: The significant rise in shares signals investor optimism ahead of the earnings announcement, showcasing MobiKwik's growth potential in the fintech sector.

item.title: Sony and Honda's new Afeela electric car to start at $89,900, but only for buyers in California - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Sony and Honda Launch Afeela Electric Car Starting at $89,900, Initially for California Buyers

Date: Jan 07, 2025 08:30 AM IST Source: Hindustan Times

Sony and Honda have teamed up to introduce the 'Afeela,' an electric vehicle (EV) available for pre-orders at CES 2025 in Las Vegas. Initially, the car will be sold only in California.

  • The Afeela comes in two trims: Afeela 1 Origin at $89,900 and Afeela 1 Signature at $102,900.
  • Includes a three-year subscription to in-car features like Level 2+ driver assist and AI-powered personal assistant.
  • Offers up to 300 miles of EPA-estimated range and supports Tesla's Supercharger network.
  • Initial delivery for Signature trim starts in 2026, while Origin will follow in 2027.
  • Features advanced technology including 40 sensors, cameras, and potential augmented reality integration.
“Come on out, Afeela” - Yasuhide Mizuno, CEO of Sony Honda Mobility.

The Afeela represents a significant step in Sony and Honda's collaboration, reflecting the rising demand for EVs. Details on shopping for the vehicle will be announced soon.

item.title: Stocks to watch, January 7: Manappuram Finance, Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea, BPCL, Bajaj Finserv, Kalyan Jewellers, and more - Upstox
item.description:
Stocks to Watch, January 7

Date: January 7, 2024

Source: Market Insights

The domestic equity market is expected to open positively today, following a rise in Asian shares and on the back of hopes for a less aggressive tariff approach from the incoming US President.

  • Bajaj Finserv: Reported a general insurance premium of ₹1,331 crore and life insurance premium of ₹1,055 crore for December.
  • Kalyan Jewellers: Achieved a consolidated revenue growth of approximately 39% YoY, with India operations up 41%.
  • Adani Enterprises: Entered a joint venture with Thailand's Indorama Resources for petrochemicals.
  • Manappuram Finance: Confirmed a daylight robbery incident at a branch in Odisha, with a loss of gold and cash.
  • ICICI Prudential Life: Received a GST tax demand order for FY2019 to FY2021.
  • Caplin Point: Received an Establishment Inspection Report from the US FDA with zero observations.
  • BPCL, GAIL, IGL: Maharashtra Natural Gas plans to launch an IPO exceeding ₹1,000 crore.
  • M&M: Increased production by 19.92% year-on-year in December 2024.
  • Bharti Airtel, Vodafone Idea: Agreed to sell their stakes in Firefly Networks to iBus Network.
“The company remains on track to achieve double-digit growth for the full financial year.” - SH Kelkar

The market's positive outlook today reflects various key developments, and investors are advised to watch these stocks closely.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment Share Price LIVE: Stock climbs 10% after listing at 19% premium on NSE - Upstox
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment Share Price LIVE: Stock climbs 9% after listing at 19% premium on NSE

Publication Date: January 7, 2024

Source: Upstox

Indo Farm Equipment's shares made a strong debut on the National Stock Exchange, climbing significantly above the issue price.

  • Traded volume: 214.51 lakh
  • Traded value: ₹593.99 crore
  • Total market cap: ₹1,333.14 crore
  • Current price: ₹278.6 (+8.83%)
  • Issue price: ₹215
  • Open: ₹256
  • High: ₹287
  • Low: ₹256
“The fresh issue proceeds will be used for business expansion, including setting up a dedicated plant for manufacturing capacity.”

This IPO has seen a remarkable subscription rate, with a total of 229.68 times oversubscription.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing Date, Share Price LIVE: Stock to list on the NSE and the BSE today - Upstox
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Listing Date, Share Price LIVE

Date: January 7, 2023
Source: Upstox

The shares of Indo Farm Equipment were listed at a premium on the National Stock Exchange, reflecting strong investor interest during the IPO.

  • Shares debuted at ₹256, a premium of 19.07% over the issue price of ₹215.
  • The current stock price as of 10:39 am is ₹282.21, up 10.24%.
  • The IPO was subscribed 229.68 times, indicating high demand.
  • The minimum lot size for retail investors was set at 69 shares.
  • Proceeds from the IPO will be used for business expansion and loan repayment.
"The non-institutional investors led the demand, subscribing 503.83 times their portion."

The successful listing of Indo Farm Equipment's shares marks a significant event in the financial market, showcasing the company's strong market interest and backing by investors.

item.title: Zomato Cut To Hold By Jefferies As Quick Commerce Race Poses Threat To Profitability - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Zomato Cut To 'Hold' By Jefferies As Quick Commerce Race Poses Threat To Profitability

Date: 07 Jan 2025

Source: NDTV Profit

Zomato Ltd. has seen its shares downgraded by Jefferies to 'hold', citing increased competition that threatens its profitability.

  • Analysts expect a consolidation year after the stock's value doubled in 2024.
  • Jefferies lowered its target price for Zomato shares from Rs 335 to Rs 275.
  • Rivals like Swiggy have also experienced significant growth post-listing.
  • The company faces challenges from new entrants in the quick commerce space.
“We are worried about the rise in quick commerce competition,” said Jefferies analysts.

The significance of this downgrade reflects the competitive landscape that food delivery services like Zomato must navigate in the coming quarters.

item.title: Stock Recommendations Today: Zomato, Phoenix Mills, Shriram Finance On Brokerages Radar - NDTV Profit
item.description:
Stock Recommendations Today: Zomato, Phoenix Mills, Shriram Finance On Brokerages' Radar

Date: 07 Jan 2025 Source: NDTV Profit Desk

Jefferies, Citi, and Emkay have shared their stock recommendations for various companies in a recent analysis. Key highlights include the downgrade of Zomato Ltd by Jefferies and a strong outlook for Shriram Finance by InCred.

  • Jefferies downgraded Zomato to 'hold'; target price set at Rs 275.
  • Citi's top property pick is Phoenix Mills, indicating growth potential.
  • Emkay forecasts an uptick in non-ferrous company earnings due to rising prices.
  • InCred maintained an 'add' rating for Shriram Finance with a target price of Rs 4,250.
“Expectations of improved earnings across sectors, but competitive pressures remain significant.”

This analysis offers insights into market sentiments and potential stocks for investors to watch closely.

item.title: 10 Features The Hyundai Creta Electric Borrows From Its ICE Version - CarDekho
item.description:
Hyundai Creta Electric vs The Creta: 10 Features Electric Version Borrows From ICE Model

Publication Date: Scheduled for January 17, 2025
Source: CarDekho.com

Hyundai has unveiled the features of the upcoming Creta Electric, which shares styling and cabin layout with the ICE-powered model. The report highlights ten key features focused on convenience and safety borrowed from the regular Creta.

  • Dual 10.25-inch screens for infotainment and digital driver display.
  • Panoramic sunroof available in both models.
  • 8-speaker Bose sound system for premium audio experience.
  • Ventilated front-row seats for comfort.
  • Dual-zone automatic climate control for personalized comfort.
  • Standard 6 airbags across all variants for safety.
  • 360-degree camera system for parking assistance.
  • Level-2 ADAS for advanced safety features.
  • All-wheel disc brakes with electronic parking brake.
  • Tyre pressure monitoring system for real-time alerts.
“Prices for the Hyundai Creta Electric are set to be announced on January 17, 2025, at the upcoming Bharat Mobility Expo.”

The Creta Electric aims to compete with models like Tata Curvv EV, MG ZS EV, and Maruti Suzuki e Vitara.

item.title: Nifty 50, Sensex today: What to expect from Indian stock market in trade on January 7 as HMPV virus cases rise | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indian Stock Market Outlook for January 7 Amid Rising HMPV Virus Cases

Publication Date: January 7, 2023 | Source: Live Mint

The Indian stock market is anticipated to open higher on January 7 following positive trends in global markets, despite experiencing a significant downturn on January 6.

  • Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty 50 fell sharply on January 6, with Sensex dropping 1,258.12 points and Nifty 50 slipping below 23,700.
  • Gift Nifty indicates a potential upward opening for Nifty 50.
  • Short-term trends suggest potential further weakness with next support levels around 23,500 to 23,400.
  • Technical indicators present a mixed outlook, with caution advised due to unclear market direction.
  • Bank Nifty also faced declines and is nearing critical support zones.
“The candle pattern of Monday is indicating a bull trap of recent upside breakout and this signals more weakness in the short term.” - Nagaraj Shetti, Senior Technical Research Analyst

The market's immediate trajectory remains uncertain, with investors advised to monitor key support and resistance levels closely.

item.title: Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today — 7 January 2025 | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Breakout stocks to buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends five shares to buy today

Date: 7 January 2025

Source: Live Mint

On 7 January 2025, the Indian stock market experienced a bearish trend, with the Nifty 50 index dropping significantly. Sumeet Bagadia from Choice Broking has recommended five breakout stocks for investors to consider amidst the current market conditions.

Sumeet Bagadia's breakout stock recommendations

  • PNGS Gargi Fashion Jewellery: Buy at ₹1372.20, target ₹1470, stop loss ₹1320.
  • PTC Industries: Buy at ₹15500, target ₹17000, stop loss ₹15000.
  • JTL Industries: Buy at ₹104.25, target ₹111, stop loss ₹100.
  • NDR Auto Components: Buy at ₹795, target ₹850, stop loss ₹770.
  • Vijaya Diagnostic Centre: Buy at ₹1126.30, target ₹1212, stop loss ₹1085.
“The Indian stock market trend has turned weak after sharp selling on Monday. The Nifty 50 index has closed near the 23,600 mark, and it may try to test 23,300 levels if its current support placed at 23,500 is breached.” - Sumeet Bagadia

Investors are advised to take a stock-specific approach given the uncertain market conditions and the upcoming Q3 2024-25 results.
